body:
YOLOv3 is intended for object detection, not classification.

For classification see Resnet etc.

I know yolov3 is an object detector. I don’t think my question was clear enough then. Currently you transfer the weights of a darknet53 classifier to the backbone of Yolov3. To train the remaining layers you still need a lot of labelled data containing bounding boxes. That is very time consuming to do. What I want to do is have simpler labels. What I thought was find a way to transfer the weights of a second classifier, one that is trained to classify custom objects and fine tune the remaining parts of yolov3 using much, much less bounding box labelled data. Does that make sense? I’m not looking for a classifier as an end product, but a custom object detector. I just want to find a better way to train yolov3 for custom objects without having to label 10000 bounding boxes

Currently we use a darknet53 classifier trained on imagenet as a frozen backbone and train the remaining layers. How about we use the coco trained yolo layers as a “frontbone” and train the darknet53 classifier for custom objects ??

Hi @glenn-jocher and @pfeatherstone  , Could you please explain what do you mean that you use to transfer darknet53 weights to the backbone of yolov3? 
I wanna mention what I have done then you can know where is the problem?
first I convert yolov3.weights to .pt format, while I could not convert daknet.53.
and till now I could not use darknet53 on my server.

on my pc I was using daknet53 and it was giving a great result.

Many thanks.
@zaitoun90 to use darknet53 backbone to start training run `python3 train.py --weights darknet53.conv.74`

I guess this is still an open question? We’ve agreed that the question asks whether you can transfer a custom classifier as well as darknet53 to kick start the learning process of yolov3 for custom objects?

Any advice on how to convert YOLOv3 into a classifier? 
Quiero user las weights que entre en COCO para un problema de classification. Para ver como de bien trabaja la weights en solo classification. 

Cambie el load file. Asin I only load the state_dictionary. 
Y despues trate de connectar un classifier al final de forma "model.classifier = classifier"
Pero no me esta trabajando. Queria saber si no tenias advice en como se pudiera hacer eso? 
Se que es un problema incoveniente.

@FranciscoReveriano yes, it's actually very easy. You simply replace the FPN head with a classifier head, though the dataloading, labelling and loss are all a bit different. I'm close to releasing a new ultrlaytics/yolov4 repo that specifically creates models in two pieces (backbone and head), so you will be able to use the yolov4 backbone + a classifier head.

De momento con este repo seria un poco complicado.

Es lo que estoy mirando. Trate de escribir mi propio repo solo para classificacion. 
Que clase de Loss Function usarias? Yo estaba tratando de usar la NLLLoss. 
Para yolov4 let me know si puedo ayudar en cualquier cosa.
Para classificacion seria CEloss o BCEloss. CEloss si tus labels so pueden tener una clase (persona, perro, gato), o BCEloss si pueden tener mass de una class (persona y hombre).
